Package il.co.hac.edu.yekhezkelyo.ex1

Class EnglishCheckByLetterFreq

java.lang.Object
il.co.hac.edu.yekhezkelyo.ex1.EnglishCheckByLetterFreq
All Implemented Interfaces:
LanguageCheck
public class EnglishCheckByLetterFreq
extends java.lang.Object
implements LanguageCheck
Checks if an HTML page in a given address is in English, based on letter frequencies.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static double[] _frequencyTable
    Array indexes are ASCII values of small letters minus value of 'a', which aligns them to 0 ('a' - 'a' == 0, 'b' - 'a' == 1,...).
    static int COUNT_INCREMENT
    Defines how much to add to the count when a character is met.
    static int DEFAULT_COUNT
    Used when a character is met for the first time and does not exist in the counts yet.
    static java.lang.String ENGLISH_FACTORY_KEY
    Key to the LanguageCheckFactory to register this implementation by.
    static int EXPONENT_2
    The number 2 to use as an exponent in the computation of the variance.
    static int INDEX_TO_SIZE_OFFSET
    The difference between the index of the last cell of an array to the array's size, used to compute the size of an array by subtracting indexes of items.
    static char SMALL_A
    Small a character used for character arithmetics.
    static char SMALL_Z
    Small z character used for character arithmetics.
    private static double THRESHOLD
    This constant determines how "sensitive" the algorithm is, or how likely it is that the URL is indeed written in English.
    static int ZERO
    A general-purpose constant 0.

  • Field Details

    • _frequencyTable

      private static final double[] _frequencyTable
      Array indexes are ASCII values of small letters minus value of 'a', which aligns them to 0 ('a' - 'a' == 0, 'b' - 'a' == 1,...).

    • THRESHOLD

      private static final double THRESHOLD
      This constant determines how "sensitive" the algorithm is, or how likely it is that the URL is indeed written in English. The lower it is, the higher the probability that that URL is written in English, but it may generate a higher amount of false-negatives. The higher the threshold, the lower the amount of false-negatives, but also the higher the amount of false-positives. So this constant may require fine-tuning whenever the algorithm changes.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • register

      public static void register()
      This should be called in order to register this check in the LanguageCheckFactory.

    • checkLanguage

      public boolean checkLanguage​(java.lang.String url) throws java.io.IOException
      Attempts to "guess" the language of url based on letter frequencies.
      Specified by:
      checkLanguage in interface LanguageCheck
      Parameters:
      url - a web address of an HTML page.
      Returns:
      true if the text of url is English in high probability, else false.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if url is not reachable or not readable.

    • computeLetterFrequencies

      private double[] computeLetterFrequencies​(java.lang.String text, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> charCounts)
      Given a HashMap<Character, Integer> of the number of times each letter is in the file, computes an array of frequencies (probabilities) by dividing each count by the total length of the text.
      Parameters:
      text - the text of the file being checked
      charCounts - the number of time each letter is in text
      Returns:
      an array with the frequencies of each letter

    • getCharCounts

      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,​java.lang.Integer> getCharCounts​(java.lang.String text)
      Counts the number of occurrences of each character in text.
      Parameters:
      text - counting the occurrences of characters in this text
      Returns:
      a mapping between characters and the number of times they appear in text

    • computeVariance

      private double computeVariance​(double[] currentFrequencies)
      Given an array of frequencies of occurrences of letters in a text, computes the variance between these frequencies to a constant "global" frequency saved in _frequencyTable.
      Parameters:
      currentFrequencies - an array of frequencies of letters in some text.
      Returns:
      the variance between currentFrequencies to _frequencyTable.

    • sum

      private double sum​(double[] arr)
      Computes the sum of values in a double array.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array to sum up.
      Returns:
      the sum of values in arr.

    • indexFor

      private int indexFor​(char c)
      Returns the index of an English letter in a frequencies array. If the given char is not an English letter the behaviour is undefined.
      Parameters:
      c - the English letter to get the index of.
      Returns:
      c's index in a frequencies array.
